intro: Psychotria christophersenii, commonly known as the Christophe's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in its native range.
